Package ohos.agp.components

Class ScrollView.ReboundEffectParams

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.ScrollView.ReboundEffectParams

    public static class ScrollView.ReboundEffectParams
extends Object
    Represents rebound effect parameters.
    Since:
    4

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReboundEffectParams

        public ReboundEffectParams​(int overscrollPercent,
                           float overscrollRate,
                           int remainVisiblePercent)
        A constructor used to create a ReboundEffectParams instance.
        Parameters:
        overscrollPercent - Indicates the overscroll percent (default value: 40). If the percent of scrolled content exceeds the value of this parameter, the content scrolling speed is affected by the overscrollRate parameter. Specifically, if the value of overscrollRate is less than 1.0, your finger moves faster than the content.
        overscrollRate - Indicates the overscroll rate (default value: 0.6). This parameter affects the content scrolling speed if the percent of scrolled content exceeds the value of the overscrollPercent parameter. Specifically, the content scrolling speed is equal to the finger scrolling speed multiplied by the value of overscrollRate.
        remainVisiblePercent - Indicates the minimum percent of scrollable content that should remain visible during overscrolling. The default value is 20.
        Since:
        4

    • Method Detail

      • getOverscrollPercent

        public int getOverscrollPercent​()
        Obtains the value of the overscrollPercent parameter.

        If the percent of scrolled content exceeds the value of this parameter (default value: 40), the content scrolling speed is affected by the overscrollRate parameter. If the value of overscrollRate is less than 1.0, your finger moves faster than the content.

        Returns:
        Returns the value of overscrollPercent.
        Since:
        4

      • getOverscrollRate

        public float getOverscrollRate​()
        Obtains the value of the overscrollRate parameter.

        This parameter affects the content scrolling speed if the percent of scrolled content exceeds the value of the overscrollPercent parameter. Specifically, the content scrolling speed is equal to the finger scrolling speed multiplied by the value of overscrollRate (default value: 0.6).

        Returns:
        Returns the value of overscrollRate.
        Since:
        4

      • getRemainVisiblePercent

        public int getRemainVisiblePercent​()
        Obtains the value of the remainVisiblePercent parameter.

        This parameter indicates the minimum percent of scrollable content that should remain visible during overscrolling. The default value is 20.

        Returns:
        Returns the value of remainVisiblePercent.
        Since:
        4

      • setOverscrollPercent

        public void setOverscrollPercent​(int overscrollPercent)
        Sets the value for the overscrollPercent parameter.

        This parameter indicates the overscroll percent (default value: 40). If the percent of scrolled content exceeds the value of this parameter, the content scrolling speed is affected by the overscrollRate parameter. Specifically, if the value of overscrollRate is less than 1.0, your finger moves faster than the content.

        Parameters:
        overscrollPercent - Indicates the value of overscrollPercent.
        Since:
        4

      • setOverscrollRate

        public void setOverscrollRate​(float overscrollRate)
        Sets the value for the overscrollRate parameter.

        This parameter indicates the overscroll rate (default value: 0.6). It affects the content scrolling speed if the percent of scrolled content exceeds the value of the overscrollPercent parameter. Specifically, the content scrolling speed is equal to the finger scrolling speed multiplied by the value of overscrollRate.

        Parameters:
        overscrollRate - Indicates the value of overscrollRate.
        Since:
        4

      • setRemainVisiblePercent

        public void setRemainVisiblePercent​(int remainVisiblePercent)
        Sets the value for the remainVisiblePercent parameter.

        This parameter indicates the minimum percent of scrollable content that should remain visible during overscrolling. The default value is 20.

        Parameters:
        remainVisiblePercent - Indicates the value of remainVisiblePercent.
        Since:
        4
